result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Lee Haggard Jr

defendant.name: Haggard, Jessie Lee, Jr
defendant.address: 5511 West National Avenue #228, West Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Jessie Lee Haggard Jr.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Pretrial scheduling Order, signed and filed. Court. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Jessie Lee Haggard not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requested an adjournment due to needing more time to review discovery; defense received paper discovery but not digital discovery.  State does not object.  Defendant filed motion to dismiss for not having a preliminary hearing.  Defense counsel to advise defendant that the court takes no action on motion as the defendant had a preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Dismiss from Defendant (Jessie L. Haggard Jr. - Milwaukee County Jail 949 N. 9th Street. Milwaukee, WI. 53233)

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Detective J. Bohn. Court took judicial notice of 18CF2729. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to the trial court.  
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard not in court, defendant in custody.  Greg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. GPS TOT no alternative. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant to have no contact with ENL.

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
